page.title: 01Glen Girnock and The Dee
page.content: The area lies approximately half way between Ballater and Crathie on the south side of the River Dee in the Upper Deeside. It is sparsely populated. Most houses in Glen Girnock, which provide a natural boundary to the East, West and South of the block are empty or ruinous. The hills in the area -Creag nam Ban (rocky hill of hte women) Sea Charlle (The old wood) and Sgor an h Colaire (peak of the eagle) are now bare of trees, craggy and rarely climbed. The south-west corner in the lower ground closer to the Dee is farmed by Abergeldie Estate,the main landowner here. The small population here includes retired estate workers, present estate workers and people residient only in the summer months. Roe deer live here all year round. Hawk, pheasant, grouse and even
